page.title: 09EDUCATION New Schools
page.content: The oldest school in town is London Road School. Its buildings are Victorian and have started to deteriorate with damp, rot and leaking rooves. They are now having a{new {school}built in the grounds of Oakmeeds School.They will change their name when they open in September 1985. The housing around the town has expanded and so the{newest school}is Sheddingdean Infants School in the north of the town.It has opened in a spare room at Manor Field School while they put up the actual building. All of the schools stand in their own grounds. St.Wilfrid's and Southway have their own{swimming pools.}Most schools have a good stock of{books, and now have a variety of{computers and software. Southway, St.Wilfrid's, Manor Field, London Road, Oakmeeds and Birchwood Grove have BBC computers.
